item.title: SOLVED: Spotify desktop client communication failed
item.description:
If you receive the messageÂ Spotify desktop client communication failed when trying toÂ Login with Facebook to the Spotify app hereâ€™s why and how to fix it.

Reason

It was because I have 2 factor security turned on.

Resolution

  1. Go to https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=security&view
  2. On the line App Passwords click Edit
  3. Click the Generate App Passwords link
  4. Click theÂ Generate App PasswordsÂ button
  5. Enter a friendly name for what this is for i.e. Spotify
  6. ClickÂ Generate Password
  7. Copy the password in theÂ normalÂ spotify logon password box.
  8. enter your FB email address as the username.
  9. HEY PRESTO!

item.title: Landscapify â€“ Adjusting Portrait Photos for Landscape Frames
item.description:
Iâ€™ve been making a lot more use of my digital photo frame since I moved into my flat but a fair few of the photos I want to make use of are portrait orientation whilst the majority are landscape.

For a load of photos Iâ€™ve gone thru them and manually made them landscape by using a method I noticed that Youâ€™ve Been Framed use when viewers send in mobile footage shot in the wrong orientation for tv. The technique is to enlarge a second copy of the image/video as a background layer to fit the width of the landscape orientation and blur the background.

I figured as Iâ€™d want to do this to a lot of images over time Iâ€™d make a script to do so. So using Photoshopâ€™s Actions Iâ€™ve done so and thought Iâ€™d share it:Â Landscapify â€“ Mike Dixson.atnÂ Hereâ€™s how to load the actions into your PhotoshopÂ http://www.imphotography.com/downloads/installactions.htm

Instructions

  1. Open Image
  2. In the Actions Window click on Landscapify
  3. Click the Play Icon >
  4. When prompted for the new canvas size enter the current width as the height and the current height as the width
  5. Click Ok (if prompted that clipping will occur click Ok to that too
  6. Youâ€™re done ðŸ™‚

Hope itâ€™s useful to you.
Mike
